meanings.definition: The state of being confused or puzzled.
meanings.sent1: His constant bewilderments in class made it hard for him to keep up with the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The many bewilderments in the maze left the children feeling lost and unsure of which way to go.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's bewilderments at seeing its reflection in the mirror were both adorable and amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of bewilderments, each thought more tangled than the last.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in plans caused a wave of bewilderments to wash over the group.

meanings.definition: Things that cause confusion or puzzlement.
meanings.sent1: The strange symbols on the ancient artifact were bewilderments to the archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected turn of events presented new bewilderments for the detectives to unravel.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick left the audience in delightful bewilderments, trying to figure out how it was done.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were a maze of bewilderments, with signs pointing in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The old riddle was full of clever bewilderments that stumped even the brightest minds.
